results.title: Cochin
results.creator_credit: Chris McCullough and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into India”.
Keith Adam makes a journey to the spicelands of south-west India, to the state of Kerala, a narrow strip of coastal plain.

group_siblings.title: The Moghul emperors
group_siblings.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: The Moghul emperors
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into India”.
The Moghuls, described by some historians as the most brilliant dynasty of emperors in modern times, ruled India from the 16th century to the middle of the 18th century. Keith Adam visits many of the monuments they created, including the Taj Mahal, and recreates their colourful history.

results.title: The Kulu valley
results.creator_credit: Chris McCullough and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into India”.
Keith Adam takes viewers on a trek through the Kulu Valley in the middle of the Himalayan Mountain Range, a fertile strip of flat land between high snow-capped mountains.

results.title: The Future of Our Press
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journalism Resource Tapes”.
Creighton Burns, Editor of the Age and Harry Gordon former Editor in Chief of the Herald and Weekly Times discuss the current decline of the newspaper industry. They give their opinions and make their predictions as to the future of journalism and the newspaper houses.

results.title: Law Affecting Journalism
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journalism Resource Tapes”.
Creighton Burns, Editor of “The Age”, and Harry Gordon, former Editor-in-Chief at “The Herald and Weekly Times”, discuss the law of libel, defamation, and the problems and benefits of these laws in the journalist’s world.

results.title: Ethics and the Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journalism Resource Tapes”.
Creighton Burns, Editor of the Age and Harry Gordon, former Editor in Chief of the Herald and Weekly Times, discuss issues relating to journalism’s code of ethics. They discuss what their in-house rules are relating to ethics and integrity within their journalistic world.

results.title: The Birthday present
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Film Australia and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Johnson and friends”.
Johnson, a courageous pink elephant, leads his friends on a series of adventures. He is joined by Alfred, a leaky hot-water bottle, McDuff, a cheeky concertina, Diesel the dump truck and Squeaky the battered robot. The stories on this tape include: “The Birthday present”, “Playing games”, “Sharing”, “The Picnic”, “Windchimes” and “Cleaning day”.

results.title: Dinosaur tracks
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Johnson and friends”.
Johnson and his friends get together in six stories. In “Diesel tries to fly” all the toys are put in danger as Diesal tries out his wings. Squeaky’s good at guarding the bedroom but what about the “Dinosaur tracks”? Is Johnson falling apart as the toys follow the mysterious “Pink thread.” “Melissa’s dinosaur”, Victoria is introduced to the toys. In “Diesel who?”, the toy loses his memory after a nasty crash. McDuff feels very superior after a visit to the toyshop, and the toys try to get her back to her old self in The Homecoming.
